metadata.title: CVE-2023-39318 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The html/template package does not properly handle HTML-like "" commenttokens, nor hashbang "#!" comment tokens, in <script> contexts. This maycause the template parser to improperly interpret the contents of <script>contexts, causing actions to be improperly escaped. This may be leveragedto perform an XSS attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.20 - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04.1
golang-1.20-go - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04.1
golang-1.20-src - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04.1
No subscription required

golang-1.21 - 1.21.1-1~ubuntu20.04.1
golang-1.21-go - 1.21.1-1~ubuntu20.04.1
golang-1.21-src - 1.21.1-1~ubuntu20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.14 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.16 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.18 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.20 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04.1').
golang-1.21 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.21.1-1~ubuntu20.04.1').
